citeinfo.origin: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), Marshall Space Flight Center
citeinfo.title: Polar Sea Ice Concentration & Brightness Temperature

descript.abstract: This data set contains mapped sea ice concentrations derived from calibrated brightness temperature data (CBTT) from the Nimbus-5 Electrically Scanning Microwave Radiometer (ESMR). Sea ice concentration values (expressed in percent ice cover) are binned into 30 km x 30 km grid and averaged. These monthly and yearly averages are mapped onto 293 x 293 polar stereographic grids for the Arctic and Antarctic regions (90 to 50ï¾¡ N and S). These maps are available from the National Space Sciences Data Center on one 6250 bpi tape for Arctic data and one for Antarctic.
descript.purpose: Mapped sea ice concentrations derived from calibrated brightness temperature data (CBTT) from the Nimbus-5 Electrically Scanning Microwave Radiometer (ESMR). Sea ice concentration values (expressed in percent ice cover) are binned into 30 km x 30 km grid and averaged.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
